(2, 5).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew shows an anatomical animation on the monitor.)  An arrhythmia is any abnormal heart rhythm; when it's too slow, less than 60 beats per minute, it's called bradycardia; when it's too fast, more than 100 beats per minute, it's called this, from the Greek for "swift" & "heart"
